perturbation.original_text: Developer will design, develop, and deliver, satisfactory to Client, the "Pelican Delivers Application Phase 1" (collectively, the Subject Program), and all elated Project services (collectively, the Services), Project work product (collectively, the Deliverables), and user manuals and other written material that describe he functionality or assist in the use of the Subject Program (collectively, the Documentation), pursuant to the Project specifications detailed in the SO (collectively, Specifications), as described in the enclosed statement of work (the SOW; as provided in APPENDIX A hereto). The Parties may execute multiple SOWs should there be multiple or separate Projects. In the event of any conflict or inconsistency between the terms of this Agreement and any SOW, the terms of this Agreement will control.
perturbation.changed_text: Developer will design, develop, and deliver, satisfactory to Client, the "Pelican Delivers Application Phase 1" (collectively, the Subject Program), and all elated Project services (collectively, the Services), Project work product (collectively, the Products), and user manuals and other written material that describe he functionality or assist in the use of the Subject Program (collectively, the User Guides), pursuant to the Project specifications detailed in the SO (collectively, Requirements), as described in the enclosed statement of work (the SOW; as provided in APPENDIX A hereto). The Parties may execute multiple SOWs should there be multiple or separate Projects. In the event of any conflict or inconsistency between the terms of this Agreement and any SOW, the terms of this Agreement will control.
perturbation.explanation: Replacing 'Deliverables' with 'Products', 'Documentation' with 'User Guides', and 'Specifications' with 'Requirements' introduces inconsistent terminology for the same concepts, creating confusion regarding the precise obligations and scope of work. It becomes unclear if 'Products' and 'Deliverables' are the same. This introduces ambiguity, weakening enforcement.

perturbation.original_text: Client shall provide Developer assistance to complete the Services, and produce the Deliverables, as reasonably requested, including but not limited to providing the necessary information or documentation required from Developer for the development of the Subject Program. Client shall conduct all Acceptance Tests in good faith and shall not delay any acceptance of any Service or Deliverable without reasonable justification. The evaluation of any Service or Deliverable for any Acceptance Test will be based on material compliance with applicable Specifications and Client shall not arbitrarily withhold acceptance of any Milestone Deliverable or Subject Program.
perturbation.changed_text: Client shall provide Developer assistance to complete the Services, and produce the Products, as reasonably requested, including but not limited to providing the necessary information or documentation required from Developer for the development of the Project. Client shall conduct all Quality Checks in good faith and shall not delay any acceptance of any Service or Product without reasonable justification. The evaluation of any Service or Product for any Quality Check will be based on material compliance with applicable Requirements and Client shall not arbitrarily withhold acceptance of any Milestone Product or Subject Program.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Deliverables' to 'Products', 'Acceptance Tests' to 'Quality Checks', and 'Specifications' to 'Requirements' in this section creates further confusion. The document now uses different terms for essentially the same concepts (testing, requirements, and project output). This ambiguity can lead to disputes over whether the correct processes are being followed and if the project outputs meet the required standards. What exactly is the difference between products and deliverables?

perturbation.original_text: The Client and the Designer both agree to never to disparage or speak ill of the other party to anyone and or post negative or disparaging comments Online regarding any of the Designer's products, services, affiliates, subsidiaries, officers, directors, employees or shareholders, and will take reasonable steps to prevent and will not knowingly permit any of their respective employees or agents to, disparage or speak ill of such persons. For purposes of this Section, "disparage" shall mean any negative statement whether written or oral, about Seattle Software Developers, Inc., Dot Com LLC. and or any of its affiliates. The Client and Designer both agree not to post on defamatory websites or review websites any negative posts concerning each other, the names of our companies, and our employees. Both the Client and the Designer both agree and acknowledge that this non-disparagement provision is a material term of this Agreement, the absence of which would have resulted in the Company refusing to enter into this Agreement. Subject to the terms, conditions, express representations and warranties provided in this Agreement, Designer and Client both agree to indemnify, save and hold armless each other from any and all damages, liabilities, costs, losses or expenses arising out of any finding of fact which is inconsistent with Designer's representations and warranties made herein, except in the event any such claims, damages, liabilities, costs, losses or expenses arise directly as a result of gross negligence or misconduct of Client.
perturbation.changed_text: The Customer and the Developer both agree to never to disparage or speak ill of the other party to anyone and or post negative or disparaging comments Online regarding any of the Developer's products, services, affiliates, subsidiaries, officers, directors, employees or shareholders, and will take reasonable steps to prevent and will not knowingly permit any of their respective employees or agents to, disparage or speak ill of such persons. For purposes of this Section, "disparage" shall mean any negative statement whether written or oral, about Seattle Software Developers, Inc., Dot Com LLC. and or any of its affiliates. The Customer and Developer both agree not to post on defamatory websites or review websites any negative posts concerning each other, the names of our companies, and our employees. Both the Customer and the Developer both agree and acknowledge that this non-disparagement provision is a material term of this Agreement, the absence of which would have resulted in the Company refusing to enter into this Agreement. Subject to the terms, conditions, express representations and warranties provided in this Agreement, Developer and Customer both agree to indemnify, save and hold armless each other from any and all damages, liabilities, costs, losses or expenses arising out of any finding of fact which is inconsistent with Developer's representations and warranties made herein, except in the event any such claims, damages, liabilities, costs, losses or expenses arise directly as a result of gross negligence or misconduct of Client.
perturbation.explanation: Switching “Client” to “Customer” and “Designer” to “Developer” creates confusion about whether these terms are truly interchangeable. Throughout the agreement, both parties are referenced with the first set of terms, but in this particular section, the words are changed. This misalignment raises questions about who the non-disparagement clause protects and whether obligations extend to both terms or merely one.
